There are a record number of immigrant kids being held in federal custody—more than 14,000. We must end this horrific and inhumane practice by the Trump admin and stand in solidarity with immigrant families as we push for comprehensive immigration reform. https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2018/11/there-are-now-more-than-14000-immigrant-kids-in-federal-custody-a-new-record/

RT @foe_us .@BernieSanders: "We need millions of people all over this country to stand up and demand fundamental changes in our energy policy in order to protect our kids and our grandchildren and the planet."

We will hold a live streamed town hall Monday Dec. 3 at 7 PM to discuss the crisis of climate change and how we solve it. More info here: https://www.facebook.com/events/326982228114064 https://twitter.com/FaceTheNation/status/1066732123116236803 QT @FaceTheNation .@SenSanders talks climate change: It is very clear that we have got to bring our people together to address this terribly important issue. We must chart a different path forward. As a nation, we can build upon the leadership of towns, cities, and states across the country to move to a cleaner, greener, and economically secure future.

Increasing temperatures & extreme weather are projected to harm our agriculture industry, threatening farming communities & food security. And our nation’s aging infrastructure will be pushed to the limits by extreme weather events, threatening our national security & economy.

Human health will be directly impacted by climate change, with extreme weather and climate-related events effecting our clean air and clean water, spreading diseases to new places, and increasing heat-related stress on vulnerable populations.

A new report from top scientists confirmed that we have entered the era of climate consequences. Communities across the nation are already experiencing climate change & those impacts will only get more severe if we don't act now. https://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-climate-report-federal-government-20181123-story.html

Every day in Massachusetts, 5 people die from opioid-related overdoses. It’s time to tackle the #OpioidEpidemic head-on & pass the #CAREact. My plan would provide $100 billion to our hardest-hit communities, & give them the tools they need to fight back.​http://www.southcoasttoday.com/news/20181116/report-overdoses-taking-more-than-5-people-per-day

A local California artist is selling his artwork to raise money for the victims of the Camp Fire in Paradise, California. So far he’s raised more than $100K, with people from across the country and the world contributing. 
http://www.ktvu.com/news/artist-from-the-bay-area-raises-more-than-100k-to-help-firefighters-and-victims-of-camp-fire
